name: Nitrogen & Phosphorus Concentrations
functionStatement: Nitrogen and phosphorus transformations feed primary production, regulate excess loads, and store or release nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Nutrients near natural/guidelines unless higher levels are normal (e.g., blackwater).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compile recent total nitrogen and total phosphorus data and compare to regional guidelines. Where data are absent, use watershed export models for context.

inputs.label: Nitrogen & Phosphorus Concentrations
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Near background or guideline values. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slightly elevated N or P. / Marked elevation with likely ecological effects. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Significantly above guidelines indicating strong nutrient pollution. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
